SENT.plain: Two unrelated children with Marfan syndrome presented with recurrent intracranial hypertension
Both children complained of headache, nausea, and vomiting and one of them had papilledema
Both had increased cerebrospinal fluid pressure, and their complaints disappeared after lumbar puncture
Although severe headache has been reported in Marfan syndrome due to intracranial hypotension, this is to our knowledge the first report of intracranial hypertension in Marfan patients
